Node.definition: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put in/to/on (one's) heart; hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

Node.gloss: to be taken away|to die|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a person or animal is removed from existence; ◄ either in a natural and peaceful manner or in an unnatural and violent way

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

Node.gloss: to be taken away|to die|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a person or animal is removed from existence; ◄ either in a natural and peaceful manner or in an unnatural and violent way
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as a child of that attribute, attitude, or behavior

Node.gloss: to practice soothsaying, divination|to tell fortunes, the future
Node.definition: = action by which someone foretells future events by using magic, casting spells, or conjuring up spirits; forbidden by the Law of Moses
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as offspring of that attribute, attitude, or behavior
= action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry

Node.gloss: to prostitute oneself|to play the prostitute
Node.definition: = action by which humans engage in prostitution; ≈ associated with unfaithfulness

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which humans open their mouth widely in order to put out one's tongue, to be fed, or to shout
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
literally: to lengthen one's tongue; hence: = to stick out one's tongue ► in order to express one's joy at someone else's misfortune
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as a child of that attribute, attitude, or behavior
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as offspring of that attribute, attitude, or behavior
= state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions
= state in which humans experience an excitement of the body ◄ caused by a craving for food or sex

= tree, more commonly known as אֵלָה (אֵלָה) with a broad crown, heavy branches, and thick trunk; may reach a height of 7.5 to 9 m.; sheds its leaves; has small an inconspicuous flowers; ◄ pictacia terebinthus; ► its stem contains aromatic turpentine, a resinous juice, which flows out when the bark is cut; it provides pleasant shade; ≈ imposing tree, preferred place to sit under and enjoy the shade, associated with cultic worship
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= state in which an object has a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations; ≈ often associated with danger and insincerity
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= someone with whom one has a close, affectionate, and exclusive relationship ◄ as if it were a private possession
= the object that is to become someone's property through casting the lot

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance
= action by which humans pour out a liquid, such as wine (יַיִן) oil (שֶׁמֶן) or even blood (דָּם) before a deity ► as a sacrifice
literally: to make go up; hence: = causative process by which humans offer a burnt offering and cause its smoke to go up
= a generic terms for an offering made to a deity
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= state by which humans or deities are having second thoughts about past actions or plans for the future
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

Node.gloss: to become high|to be lifted up
Node.definition: = process by which an object increases in height

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y

= a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability
= upright part of a door frame; a few passages mention square door frames and in such cases the horizontal elements are also referred to as doorposts

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= an object that serves as a reminder to humans or deities of things that have happened or need to be done
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which brings shame on that person and to those who stand in a close relation to them

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= causative action by which humans or deities increase the size of an area or object

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= action by which humans move from one place to another

= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity|= deity; ► worshipped by Canaanites (כְּנַעֲנִי) usually vocalized as מֹלֶךְ (מֹלֶךְ)

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= one who represents a person in authority and delivers his messages
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to give up|to consider useless|to consider hopeless
Node.definition: = process by which someone resigns to being unable to change a situation, and gives up trying to do so
literally: coming to life again; hence: = recurring
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to fear|to worry|to be anxious|to be afraid|to be distressed
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear, anxiety, or distress ◄ out of uncertainty of what might happen to themselves or their beloved ones; ► which may express itself in trembling and shaking of the body

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put in/to/on (one's) heart; hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= collection of objects

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety
= action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand
literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans pick up (part of) an object with their hands
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

literally: to be, become high; hence: = processs by which humans or deities acquire an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified

literally: to be lifted up = state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= an adverb that specifies unending time

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

literally: crushed; hence: = state in which someone has suffered harm and humiliation, ◄ as if crushed with a heavy object|literally: crushed: hence: = state of having become humble and remorseful ◄ by having suffered harm and humiliation
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= to inspire new hope, confidence, and happiness
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= to inspire new hope, confidence, and happiness
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to crush|to make humble|to make contrite
Node.definition: literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to feel humble and remorseful ◄ by causing that person to suffer harm and humiliation
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
= state in which humans are totally without inner strength; ◄ caused by physical or non physical suffering
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

literally: to hide (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which a deity does not engage with people, and does not intervene neither in their favor nor to punish, ◄ as if he were enable to see them
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= a person or group that has turned away from someone they had pledged to serve
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself
= state in which deities experience a desire to make humans feel relief after a time of grief
= pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

Node.gloss: to create (an event)|to cause to happen
Node.definition: = causative action by which a deity causes something to happen that did not happen before

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= process by which large bodies of water move back and forth as result of natural forces
= state in which an inanimate object does not move

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= causative action by which large bodies of water move back and forth and in the process throw up some the muddy substance contained by them
= wet soil; ◄ tossed up by the sea; ≈ regarded as a valueless substance

= wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
